task.title: Choosing a resume format
task.shortdesc: Your CV format will play a big part in it’s success.

context.p: If the information in your CV is well-arranged and presented in a simple and professional style – it will be easy for recruiters to navigate it and digest the content. If the information is poorly laid-out, cramped or messy, then readers will struggle to read it, and probably skip past it.

info.p: Use writing software like Microsoft Word or Google Docs to create a Word document or PDF (you could also use an online CV builder).
This makes it easy for all recruiters and hiring managers to read it.
With bold headings and space to make it easy for recruiters to jump to the sections they need.
Loud colours can be off-putting and look unprofessional, so keep it muted.
They take up valuable space and do not add any value to the CV (unless you are a model or actor)
To break up information and provide a pleasant reading experience.

taskbody.postreq:
This is an overview of what to include in your CV
Name and contact details
Profile / Personal statement
Core skills section
Work experience
Education and qualifications
Hobbies and interests (maybe)
